message:
Im in a real bad situation !!!

One of our solutions -a part of it- is a secret , we don't have any copy of out of MY OLD LAPTOP.
I was looking back to it 2 days ago and i found some stupid virus inside all Javascript files !!!!

When you try to publish it , and as soon as its published  you open the dist folder and the antivirus deletes all JavaScript files.

ANY HELP !!!

Update 
1- we should include this module on a client solution next week , we built our plan as if this is ready !
2- Im afraid to move the solution for other PCs inside the company , i tried Windows Defender and AVG on the old laptop , should i try another antivirus on  that laptop ?
3- Does Git repositories check for Maleware, if i pushed it to github will it check for maleware , i think it might be an exe file or the IDE on the laptop that injects something in the published version !!!

P.S. I need to make sure the solution is clean before moving it into another PC inside the company network.

data.message: You can't sanitize them manually ? Is it the jQuery virus that have been going wild recently ?
NOTHING written in those files i opened it with more than one editor to see  !
could you share the anitvirus message ?
i dont think you can upload a file of those javascript to an online repo , hmm you can use boxjs to analyse the issue and remove manually , the message is insanely unhelpful !!!
Did you check framework files , jQuery if it was used specially ?
Try to use a VM to deploy your project while removing Internet access I guess you should try another antivirus maybe it blacklisted all JavaScript files
You may boot into a live Linux distribution, I think this would work.
And then , this is a .Net Solution after all ! Ammar Sherif
